title: Adjusting should-stop parameter to javac to recent changes.
body: The "--should-stop:at=" javac option has been changed to "--should-stop=at=" in JDK11, adjusting to format that should work both before and after the change.

title: [NETBEANS-309] Add licenseinfo.xml for image data clarifying license status
body:
Most of the icons used in netbeans today were part of the donation zip
from oracle. As oracle removed several image files prior to donation, I
have to assume that they exercised due diligence regarding images
and considered these donateable.

The icons not having been donated came from apache committers, so are
considered save.

This changeset documents that state in the licenseinfo.xml files per module.
The informarion is summarized into rat-appendix.txt.

title: netbeans-480: ConvertToDiamondBulkHint disabled for var type variable initialization
body:
Fix hint 'Use diamond inference'  is disabled for var type  variable initialization.

var list = new ArrayList<String>();

title: Fixing 'downgrading to 1.8' log messages by producing module bootpath…
body: … in Maven even when module-info is not present; and propagating the module bootpath as needed in Maven persistence.

title: [NETBEANS-539] Support for JDK 10 and JDK 11 classfiles.
Allow action hiding in toolbars
body: The Editor already contains support for action hiding feature in popup menus. Let's enhance editor toolbars as well.

title: Enable creation using methods with Map parameter
body: FileSystem implementation supports methodValue attribute for methods, which take Map as a parameter, but the LayerBuilder did not.

title: Better consistency between SaveCookie presence and modified status
body:
The overriden setModified() removes save cookie if the "modified" status is false. The trouble is, that if during invocation of listeners, ..., some cod manages to get the object un-modified again for some reason. Then the cookie is not removed since (local) modified variable no longer corresponds the isModified() result.
The object reports isModifed() == false, but has saveCookie, which enables actions etc.

I'd need the change in JS DataObject, but I put it to other DataObjects that I found overriding setModified too.

title: [NETBEANS-290] Provided support for hyperlink on dependencies.
body:
Introduced tests to help ensure I didn't break existing functionality,
as I noticed that there was some code duplication in the existing implementation
but more importantly, I couldn't see an approach to introduce this logic 
for introducing hyperlinks on dependencies within the existing class as it was.

title: nb-javac jars upgrade for NETBEANS-463 fix
body: IllegalArgumentException is thrown if we open a file with decl like var v or while typing in the editor. In this case, type returned for var is none and this is not handled in ClassFileUtil.createFieldDescriptor.  I'm ignoring this as it's invalid declaration as var type is not allowed for instance variables.

title: [NETBEANS-492] disable QuickSearchProvider for JavaHelp
body: Disabling the QuickSearchProvider for JavaHelp so that the Quick Search text field continues to work for all other QuickSearchProviders, just not for JavaHelp (until JavaHelp is included at some point in the future).

title: Change category
body: Moving the wizard into an appropriate category as requested by Geertjan.

title: [NETBEANS-519] Bump Eclipse JGit dependency to latest version
[NETBEANS-461] Better and more correct way to copy the extbrowser DLL…
body:
…s from the archive into the build.

The current code is setting up the release directory (which would also need to be cleaned by "clean", and ignored in .gitignore), but is probably setting it up too late. So when the build happens and the directory does not exist, the resources won't be copied. But if the directory exists (even if empty, probably), the resources will be copied. Using "release." properties in nbproject/project.properties should be safer. (Note that AFAIK this only works for "nb.org" projects, not for module suite projects, etc.)

title: netbeans-479: Added ConvertToVarHint to replace explicit type with var
Shielding against NPE when debugging Nashorn scripts
body: I am getting `NullPointerException` quite frequently when debugging my [Bck2Brwsr VM](http://github.com/jtulach/bck2brwsr). This change makes the code more robust.

title: LookAndFeel improvemnets for HTML UI on Windows
body: Complaints from a user on dev mailing list: font in HTML/Java Wizard doesn't match default font on Windows, and radiobuttons were not aligned with labels. This PR fixes it.

title: [NETBEANS 470] Var shows as keyword in jdk8, 9
body: SourceLevel is not passed to JavaLexer, hence version is set to default, which is the latest version supported. So version always set to 10.  Fixed by passing version as inputAttribute to JavaLexer.

title: Remove dependency on java.xml.bind module
body:
As brought up on the incubator mailing list:

https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/695c0a025f26f51e742faa52343692ef82c35f6e6c3b4bd6acd90f77@%3Cdev.netbeans.apache.org%3E

the dependency on java.xml.bind causes problems when running on JDK 11.
The module is removed from the JDK and would need to be replaced with
a direct dependency on the jaxb.library. Netbeans contains the jaxb library,
but the occurences of jaxb usage, where the library is not yet a direct
dependency, are few. So the usages were replaced with alternatives.

title: [NETBEANS 363] Fix fallback jdkhome
body: As mentioned in bug, tools.jar is not available in JDK 9, 10, hence jdk.home is getting set to fallback value ${java.home.parent} and thus gets incorrectly set to parent folder of java.home. Changing this value to java.home fixes the issue. Verified in Windows+Linux. Is this fallback value used in any other usecase?

title: [NETBEANS-461] providing ZIP file with extbrowser DLLs during build
Split into declaration and assignment issue for var type
body:
Reference jira bug : https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-465

Issue Details:
Warning hint "Split into declaration and assignment" is not valid for var type.
var v = 10;
Only declaration the var type variable causes the errors:
var v; -> cannot infer type for local variable v
   (cannot use 'var' on variable without initializer)

The hints "Split into declaration and assignment" should not show for var type declaration and assignments

title: JDK18_3 : var shows without syntax highligting in jdk10
body:
The default jdk version in JavaLexer is set as 9, but var keyword check requires min version 10. The runtime jdk version is not available via inputAttributes, hence default version value is getting used here.

Working on passing runtime jdk version via inputAttributes in another transaction and will merge separately.

title: Merge jdk18_3 ("var" support) branch to master
body:
Rudimentary support for var in code completion, lexer, etc.

Joint work of several people (vikasprabhakar fixing tests, dbalek merging nb-javac and reviewing, etc).

When testing this in a running IDE, it is currently necessary to manually download nb-javac from here:
http://plugins.netbeans.org/plugin/73454/nb-javac-library

And install it using Tools/Plugins/Downloaded.

title: If compilation during indexing fails on exception, try to fallback to…
body:
… project's output.

Running using vanilla javac (as opposed to nb-javac) is sometimes troublesome, as the indexing may crash, which may lead to additional errors in dependent source roots (where the indexing may crash as well), and missing sig/class files in the caches may have an impact on performance.

This patch is an attempt to mitigate that, by copying project  build output into the caches. This is not perfect and may have observable effects (e.g. Go to Type is unlikely to find classes in a source root where indexing crashed currently), but when the indexing crashes, having something in the caches is typically much better than having nothing.

We may need more tweaks, based on experience, but so far seems like a step in the right direction.

title: Fixing a few problems that happen during indexing using JDK's javac.
[270357] IllegalArgumentException raised by maven-indexer
body:
This exception is raised from the maven-indexer.
maven-indexer supported two formats:

- legacy/zip: zipped lucene (v2.3) index files
- gz: maven-indexer specific file format

The legacy format is no longer supported and when the indexer
encounters old index files it raises this exception.

To integrate with the existing error handling the exception
is wrapped as an IOException.

title: [NETBEANS-283] private_key in libs.git module should be renamed
Deadlock in lexing
body:
Wrapping version increment in synchronized(this) block is causing deadlocks. I don't think such wrapping is necessary. Enough to use `volatile` for such diagnostic value. Right, Bečoune?

Another possible fix (that I tried) is to _not_ fire changes under the `rootTokenList` lock. However that is a bigger change, possibly changing semantics. Right, Mílo? Thus I decided to go with the safer fix in the Javadoc module.

title: Make sure compilation of a module also compiles its tests
body:
I'd like to contribute to the quality of NetBeans codebase. One of the common problems of our own harness (in contrary to Maven) is that by default compilation compiles only code, but not tests. As such, it often happens that developers forget to update the tests when refactoring their code. Yes, such mistake would ultimately be caught by Travis job, but checking for it during regular build would catch it sooner and bring the development experience closer to what people using Maven or Gradle expect.

I've done some testing and following commands seem to build OK with my change:
```bash
incubator-netbeans$ for i in *core*; do echo $i; ant -f $i/build.xml netbeans; done
incubator-netbeans$ for i in java*; do echo $i; ant -f $i/build.xml netbeans; done
```
thus my assumption is that the change is relatively safe for NetBeans own development.

On the other hand, I changed `common.xml` (I know it is better not to touch that file), and that may influence people using the harness to build their own applications. As such I am requesting review from Jesse.

title: Fixes bug that prevents NetBeans from quitting on macOS
body:
Fixes bug that prevents NetBeans from quitting on macOS if the user previously canceled a quit

Multiple issue about how pressing Cancel on the macOS 'Quit NetBeans' menu prevents the users from even quitting.

> https://netbeans.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=268549
> https://netbeans.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=271946
> https://netbeans.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=269724
> (probably) https://netbeans.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=247690

Brought to my attention by Marco Rossi on the users@ mailing list.

It's a workaround but it has low impact. We could also call all the time `response.cancelQuit()` since it might not impact anything when a `System.exit` arrives but it seems odd to call it all the time.

Awaiting feedback.

title: Initial NBM of lib.profiler shall contain all libraries.
body:
We have a problem. The first build of NetBeans produces wrong NBM files & also wrong content of `update_tracking` directory. To simulate that run (with pre-built NetBeans) following command:
```bash
lib.profiler$ rm -rf *; git checkout -f .; ant nbm; unzip -v build/org-netbeans-lib-profiler.nbm
```
then the resulting NBM files has just **49** entries! If you run the `nbm` target once again, you get more than hundred.

This PR is fixing that. Even when running on a clean `lib.profiler` directory, it generates NBM with enough files:

title: NETBEANS-357: corrected the target folder for toolbar link for action
body: Simple fix, slightly less simple test. The toolbar registration was placed into wrong folder, so the editor did not pick the action up at all.

title: [NETBEANS-353] Using the (--)release setting in Maven projects to ret…
body: …urn an appropriate value from SourceLevelQuery. Won't affect the boot/system module class path at this time.

title: [NETBEANS-345] Fix "Move Inner to Outer Level" produces "<captured wildcard>"
Adding basic support for vars
body:
A basic support for local-variable type inference, a new feature in JDK 10. Like:
var i = 0; //will automatically infer "int"

This does not include updated nb-javac, so will only work when running without nb-javac on JDK 10 at this time.

title: Re-correcting positions used in java.completion tests to reflect curr…
body: …ent positions used in the tests.

title: [NETBEANS-341] Added initial files required for Snap packaging
body:
This files letnetbeans to be packaged with Snapraft for Linux distributions.
If you have snapcraft installed, just type snapcraft in the project root directory.

title: [NETBEANS-320] Mac modal dialogs pop-under non-modal dialogs
body:
Fixed that bug. To use the old behavior set the property “netbeans.winsys.disallow_dialog_parents” to true
Would write test, but I don’t know how one would write a test for that…

title: Profiler improvements
body: These are the changes developed by Jirka Sedláček after the branching off donation1 branch and sooner than the `incubator-netbeans` repository was created. Donating now.

title: [NETBEANS-317] (partial) Adding licenses and notice for files inside …
body:
…Apache Maven distribution.

FTR, the notice is concatenated notice from META-INF/NOTICE{.txt} files from the Maven distribution. The licenses are retrieved from the Maven distribution as well.

title: Merge pull request #1 from apache/master
body: pull last changes

title: [NETBEANS-317] (partial) Generate LICENSE, NOTICE and DISCLAIMER to m…
body: …ost jars.

title: [NETBEANS-139] Create archive sample to fix RepositoryUpdaterEventTest.
body:
[NETBEANS-139] Create archive sample to fix the RepositoryUpdaterEventTest test on parsing.nb module.
It is the same issue that this: https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/commit/d74705dffc65ae259178fb7f859fc4e8da57a5bb

I use this command to run test: ```ant -f parsing.nb -Dtest.type=unit -Dcontinue.after.failing.tests=true -Dtest.includes=org/netbeans/modules/parsing/nb/RepositoryUpdaterEventTest.java test-single```

title: Add CONTRIBUTING.md
Cleanup/Separate/Document licenses in apache netbeans
body:
With the recent release vote concerns about bundled sourcefiles were raised.
This PR tries to address these concerns. Please see the individual commits for
details.

The primary point is the introduction of a `licenseinfo.xml` file,  which addresses
individual files and marks these with their respective licenses.

This file is then used to:
- add info the LICENSE file about the sourcefile belonging to the release
- ensure license is present when build
- exclude the referenced files from rat check (they would fail it)
- create a `nbbuild/build/rat-licenseinfo.txt` with license and comment info for reviewers

Some modules where converted from the classical _rat excludes_ to this approach, 
some files were fixed by adding the license header or removing them.

title: [NETBEANS-138] Removed InjectedTasksSupportTest test.
body:
Removed InjectedTasksSupportTest test in parsing.indexing module.

The order that the indexers are run is different that the test expect.

It closes this issue [NETBEANS-138](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-138) and old bug [Bugzilla: 237764](https://netbeans.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=237764).

title: [NETBEANS-318] adding info to external file for rat exclusions
Added a way for a Platform application to customize some text in the …
body:
…about window.

Now avoiding an exception in BreakpointAnnotationProvider
Note: this is my first pull request on something that is active so let me know if I need to change anything.

title: form: Fix compile error under Java 9, method cannot be applied to types
body:
Fixes the following compile issue under Java 9. Should be fine under 1.8 and other.

```java
src/org/netbeans/modules/form/layoutsupport/griddesigner/GridDesigner.java:267: error: method get in class SystemAction cannot be applied to given types;
            ContextAwareAction undoRedoAction = SystemAction.get(undo ? org.openide.actions.UndoAction.class : org.openide.actions.RedoAction.class);
                                                            ^
  required: Class<T>
  found: undo ? org[...]class
  reason: inference variable T has incompatible equality constraints RedoAction,UndoAction
  where T is a type-variable:
    T extends SystemAction declared in method <T>get(Class<T>)

```

title: Support git replace in search history window
body:
If one needs Apache as well as pre-Apache history, one shall follow the [readme advice](https://github.com/apache/incubator-netbeans/blob/9.0-beta-rc2/README.md) and use `git replace` command to connect the two histories. Then one can use regular command line `git` commands and search both histories.

However the NetBeans IDE was showing just the recent Apache history so far. This PR is trying to fix that (at least in a search history component). Now, if you select a file (I tried `build.xml` in root of the sources) and choose *Git->Show history*, you shall see all the commits as the command line `git log build.xml` would show.

We probably need changes like this in other places as well. I want to encourage everyone to contribute. Not much `(j)git` knowledge is needed (I don't have much either). Just, when there is a `RevCommit` without parent, search for `refs/replace/$targetId` and if found, continue in the new chain of references.

Please review my attempt and feel encouraged to apply similar changes in other places in the NetBeans Git support.

title: NETBEANS-324: Maven graph widgets created in EDT
body:
The GraphConstructor visitor adds nodes / creates Widgets when the traversal is leaving root node - at the end of the visiting process. Also scene initialization includes adding layers (= widgets) to the scene, which should be done in EDT as well.
I have moved the widget creation into EDT, so the visitor is first applied to the graph, and then in EDT cached data is translated into nodes/widgets.
